parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post contains a CMF number (CMF 11240015) at the end. This strongly suggests electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are used for campaign finance reporting and are mandatory for candidates.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post mentions "Brian Cristian" multiple times, including hashtags like #briancristian, #briancristian2024, and #briancristiandeputat.  It also mentions Elena Lasconi (#elenalasconi #lasconipreședinte), who is a candidate for a different office (President). While the reference to Lasconi might seem unrelated, the overall context suggests an attempt to leverage her name for political gain. The post clearly refers to a parliamentary candidate (Brian Cristian) participating in the election.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The hashtags further suggest an attempt to maximize reach and visibility.  The use of a public platform like Facebook and the paid nature of the post confirm that it addresses the wide population.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's core message alleges irregularities in the voting process ("Voturile noastre și alegerile democratice nu sunt respectate!"), directly impacting public perception of the election's integrity.  The call to action ("de 1 Decembrie, să nu uitați să îți taxați la vot!") encourages voting, implicitly suggesting support for the candidate (Brian Cristian) who is directly mentioned in the post. This strongly indicates an electoral objective to influence voting behavior.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting. It presents allegations of electoral fraud as fact without providing evidence or allowing for counterarguments. The emotional tone and call to action further distance it from journalistic standards.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>While the post expresses strong opinions, it goes beyond expressing a personal viewpoint. The specific mention of the candidate, the use of hashtags for broader reach, and the call to action clearly aim to influence the election outcome, exceeding the bounds of personal opinion.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1326594138703691</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post exhibits several characteristics of electoral propaganda. The presence of a CMF number, direct mention of a parliamentary candidate (Brian Cristian), a clear call to action to vote, and the targeting of a wide audience through a paid Facebook post all point towards an attempt to influence the election. While the post alleges electoral irregularities, it does so in a manner lacking journalistic objectivity and neutrality, further supporting its classification as propaganda. The mention of Elena Lasconi, while seemingly unrelated, could be interpreted as an attempt to leverage her name for political gain within the context of the post.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Brian Cristian</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>USR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
USR Maramureș, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024 (ID postare: 1326594138703691), care conține propagandă electorală pentru Brian Cristian, inclusiv menționarea numărului CMF 11240015, acuzații nefondate de fraudă electorală și un apel la vot, având ca efect electoral influențarea voturilor în favoarea candidatului menționat.  Postarea, deși pretinde a fi o sesizare, este lipsită de obiectivitate și neutralitate jurnalistică, fiind evident o încercare de manipulare a opiniei publice în scop electoral.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
